Information: Annual average :math:`\text{CH}_4` (methane) emitted per ha of crop grown. **Rice** is the only crop that should be non-zero. This will be 0 for most crops (or negligible).

| Annual average :math:`\text{CH}_4` (methane) emitted per mass of crop residue burned (dimensionless).
 | 
 | See V4, C2, Equation 2.27 and Table 2.5 for equation and default emission factors.
Annual average :math:`\text{CO}_2` (carbon dioxide) emitted per mass of crop grown due to biomass growth and associated changes in carbon stock. Applies only to perennial woody crops.
Notes: See sections 5.2.1 and 5.2.2 of the `IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories <https://www.ipcc.ch/report/2019-refinement-to-the-2006-ipcc-guidelines-for-national-greenhouse-gas-inventories/>`_

Information:
| Annual average :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` (nitrous oxide) emitted per mass of crop residue burned (dimensionless).
 | 
 | See V4, C2, Equation 2.27 and Table 2.5 for equation and default emission factors.
The combustion factor :math:`C_f` gives the "proportion of prefire fuel biomass consumed" by fires. See Table 2.6, IPCC GNGHGI (2019R).

Variable: Above Ground Residue Dry Matter Intercept
Above Ground Residue Dry Matter Slope

Information: Exports of agricultural equivalent products (mass of crops).

| Used to calculate :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emissions from fertilizer application. 
 | 
 | Agriculture Fraction Dry and Agriculture Fraction Wet must sum to 1

| Used to calculate :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emissions from organic soils. 
 | 
 | Agriculture Fraction Temperate and Agriculture Fraction Tropical must sum to 1

| Used to calculate :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emissions from organic soils. 
 | 
 | Agriculture Fraction Temperate and Agriculture Fraction Tropical must sum to 1

| Used to calculate :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emissions from fertilizer application
 | 
 | Agriculture Fraction Dry and Agriculture Fraction Wet must sum to 1
Elasticity of demand for crop in category ``$CAT-AGRICULTURE$`` to the changes in income, whose proxy is gdp/capita
Notes: See the `USDSA Commodity and Food Elasticities Database <https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/commodity-and-food-elasticities/>`_ for baseline elasticies by country.

Information: Proportion of the crop yield that is used for animal feed. Used to adjust demand for crops in response to changing animal populations. Demands for non-animal feed are driven by gdp/capita. Trivial proportions (e.g., radish tops) can be ignored.
Notes: Loose proportions dervied from `Statista <https://www.statista.com/statistics/1099196/brazil-corn-animal-feed/>`_ (quantity of Maize yield used for livestock feed), `FAO <https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/QCL>`_ (total yield), and `VOX <https://www.vox.com/2014/8/21/6053187/cropland-map-food-fuel-animal-feed>`_ (conceptual importance).

Information: Yield (metric tons) per hectare of crops planted

Variable: Dry Matter Fraction of Harvested Crop
Information: See :math:`DRY` in Equation 11.7 in IPCC GNGHGI and Table 11.1A (2019R)

| Fraction of total demand for crop products that is met by imports.
 | 
 | Conceptually, represented as the % of demand for total crop products that would be needed to produce all consumed crop products.

Variable: Fraction of Food Loss Sent to Municipal Solid Waste
Information: Use this variable to represent  food lost in the supply chain that is sent to municipal solid waste streams. Includes *pre-consumer*--such as waste by distributors and retailers--waste (integrated with waste model).

Variable: Fraction of Food Produced Lost Before Consumption
Information: Fraction of food that is produced that is lost or wasted before selling. This fraction represents production-side waste (post-yield) and does not include waste by consumers.

| Fraction of residues burned. NOTE: whatever is not removed or burned is assumed to be left as inputs to crops.
 | 
 | Total of Fraction of Residues Removed and Fraction of Residues Burned must be less than or equal to 1.

| Fraction of residues removed. NOTE: whatever is not removed or burned is assumed to be left as inputs to crops.
 | 
 | Total of Fraction of Residues Removed and Fraction of Residues Burned must be less than or equal to 1.

Proportion of total **crop** area (%/100), where crop area is calculated as the product of the country's area (``area_country_ha``) and the fraction of land use that is devoted to crop land (``frac_lu_cropland``)

Variable: N Content of Above Ground Residues
Information: See :math:`N_{AG(T)}` in Equation 11.6 in IPCC GNGHGI and Table 11.1A (2019R)

Variable: N Content of Below Ground Residues
Information: See :math:`N_{BG(T)}` in Equation 11.6 in IPCC GNGHGI and Table 11.1A (2019R)
Fraction of crop area that is subject to no-till

Variable: Ratio of Above Ground Residue to Harvested Yield
Ratio of Below Ground Biomass to Above Ground Biomass

Information: Captures :math:`\text{CH}_4` emissions from rice paddies

Variable: :math:`\text{CO}_2` Emissions from Biomass Carbon Stock Changes
:math:`\text{CO}_2` Emissions from Soil Carbon in Organic Soils
Information: Emissions of :math:`\text{CO}_2` in from drained organic soils.
Final total endogenous exports following adjustments to land use (reallocation and/or import/export loss)
Final total endogenous imports following adjustments to land use (reallocation and/or import/export loss)

Variable: Changes to Agriculture Net Imports Lost
Information:
| Use this value to quantify the opportunity cost of reducing crop production for export.
 | 
 | If specifying values of **Fraction of Changes to Net Exports Met** or **Fraction of Changes to Net Imports Met**  :math:`\not= 1` (see variables in the `Land Use <../afolu.html#land_use>_` subsector), then reductions in changes to net imports may incur economic costs.
Total area of each crop given in terms of the value specified in the configuration parameter ``area_units``.
Total tonnage of crops demanded
Total tonnage of crops yielded
Proportion of cropland represented by each crop

Variable: Total Food Loss Sent to Municipal Solid Waste
Information: Total food lost in agriculture production due to waste, supply chain inefficiences, poor harvesting practices, and more that is sent to municipal solid waste.

Variable: Total Food Produced Lost Before Consumption
Information: Total food lost in agriculture production due to waste, supply chain inefficiences, poor harvesting practices, and more.
